titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Lauchlin Bernard Currie papers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-13T15:40-0800

change.item: Added links for materials on digitalcollections.hoover.org
Revised to add photograph card catalog data
revised to update encoding and add unitid
Declassified records series added by Lisa Miller
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Lauchlin Bernard Currie Papers)//EN" "currielb.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, and summaries of interviews relating to American aid to China during World War II, conditions in China, and military operations in the China-Burma-India Theater. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lauchlin Bernard Currie papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Nova Scotia, Canada
B.S., London University
Ph.D., Harvard University
Instructor, Harvard University
Professor, Fletcher Graduate School
Economist, U.S. Treasury
Author, The Supply and Control of Money
Asst. Director Research, Federal Reserve Board
Administrative Assistant to President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Director, Lend-Lease for China
Personal Representative of President Roosevelt to China
Deputy Director, Foreign Economic Administration
President, Lauchlin Currie and Company, New York
Director, International Bank Mission to Colombia
Adviser and Director, Comite de Desarrollo Economico, Colombia
Adviser, Colombian Planning Committee, 1951-1953
In retirement
Director, Robert Nathan Magadalena Valley Study
Director, Fundación para el Progreso de Colómbia
Editor and co-author, Una Política Urbana para un País en Desarrollo
Author, Plan Socio-Económico para el Atlantico
Professor of Economics, National University of Colombia
Visiting Professor, Michigan State University
Author, Accelerating Development
Royer Lecturer, University of California, Berkeley
Director and Professor, Department of Economics, National University, Colombia
Director, Center of Development Research, National University, Colombia
Co-author, Governmental Planning and Political Economy
Visiting Professor, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Author, Obstacles to Development
Visiting Professor, Glasgow University
Professor, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Adviser, National Planning Agency, Colombia
Member, Board of Savings and Housing, Colombia
Author, Ahorro, Correccion Monetaria y Construccion
Consultant to the United Nations on Urban Matters
Author, Taming the Megalopolis: A Design for Urban Growth
Member of Board of Directors, Instituto de Estudios Colombianos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Chennault, General Claire L., (code name - Groco),
Chiang Kai-shek and Chiang Kai-shek, Mme., (code name - Segac),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports correspondence, notes, and printed material, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: "History and Status of the First American Volunteer Group," Toungoo, Burma,
"Notes on Strategic Possibilities of A Small American Air Force in China"
"Present Trucking Operations as Conducted on the Burma Road and Recommendations for Their Improvement," by Daniel G. Arnstein, Harold C. Davis, and Marco F. Hellman,
"Some Observations and Impressions on the Yunnan-Burma Transportation Situation,"
Yui Fei-pang, Chairman of the Yunnan-Burma Highway, Report 1 and Report 2,
Report by Lauchlin Currie for Chiang Kai-shek
Comments on the book by two American observers in China
"Impressions of My Visit to India and Observations on the War Situation in the Pacific," address delivered at memorial service,
Ch'ien, T. S., excerpt from letter,
Chinese Flying Cadets - Training in U.S.
Chou En-lai (see Currie, Lauchlin - First Trip to China, - Chiang Kai-shek - Interviews)
Clark-Kerr, Sir Archibald - Notes on conference,
Awards - Decoration of the Order of Ching Hsin,
Interviews with Chiang Kai-shek, and compiled notes on interviews, (latter includes notes on interview with Chou En-lai),
Report by American Ambassador Nelson Johnson,
Report by Lauchlin Currie to President Roosevelt,
Report by Lauchlin Currie to President Roosevelt,
Davies, John Paton - "The China-Burma-India Theater - a Reappraisal,"
Eisenhower, President Dwight D. - Memoranda, copy of letter,
Fairbank, John K. - Memorandum on Air Program for China, (attached note by Lauchlin Currie 1942), memoranda,
Freeman, Fulton? - Conference on situation in China,
Koo, Y. C. - Notes on conference,
Kung, H. H. - Notes on conference, letter from Henry Luce, letter to Franklin Roosevelt,
Memoranda on appointment as political adviser to Chiang Kai-shek,
Lo Ying-ching - Report to Chiang Kai-shek.
Magruder, Brigadier General John. Holograph report by Lauchlin Currie entitled "The Magruder Mission,"
Marshall, General George C. - notes on interview, memorandum from Lieutenant General Brehon Somervell,
Philippine Islands - Letter to Department of State from Laurence Salisbury,
Price, Harry B. - Memorandum on "China's Economic Needs and American Aid,"
Roy, Andrew T. - Notes on conference,
Schaberg, Benjamin F., Jr. - Memorandum on "Russia as a Source of Supply for China,"
"Situation in China Since Stilwell's Recall," (carbon of article by Newsweek correspondent Harold Isaacs),
Somervell, Lieutenant General Brehon - Memorandum for General Clay,
Soong, T. V. - Memorandum for Franklin Roosevelt, newspaper clipping about Soong; notes on Soong,
Stilwell, General Joseph - Memoranda, notes; proposed message, holograph and typewritten memorandum by Stilwell entitled, "General View of the Situation,"
Sun Yat-sen, Mme. - proposed trip to the United States
Tong, Hollington - excerpts from memoranda, notes on Tong,
Wei Tao-ming - Biography; seating arrangement at Chinese Ambassador's dinner,
Wheeler, Major General R. A. - Memorandum for General Stilwell on "Monthly Shipping Tonnage Required from United States to Supply One Triangular Division in India,"
White, Theodore - Dispatch from Loyang, (also correspondence received by Lauchlin Currie about dispatch)
Wu, K. C. - Notes on conference,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 16 prints (some duplicates) of bombing of Haiphong, French Indo-China (Vietnam) August 9, 1942(?)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a memorandum for the president written by L. Currie relating to the situation in China and to U.S. foreign policy vis-a-vis that country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Available as PDF files. The PDF files are page images, so full-text search is not possible. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder by date of creation.

dao.title: OSS Research and Analysis Branch report: American Cooperation with China during the First Year of the War
